Package ConsoleMenu

Class ConsoleMenu

java.lang.Object
ConsoleMenu.ConsoleMenu
public class ConsoleMenu
extends java.lang.Object
The purpose of this class is to construct the console menu, accept and validate user inputs and call functions from the BookDAO

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int action
    an integer used to hold the users input selection in the console menu
    private java.lang.String errorMessage
    The message that is displayed if the user inputs an invalid selection
    private java.lang.String[] menuItem
    an array which holds the menu items
    private java.lang.String menuTitle
    a String which displays the current menu's title
    private java.lang.String message
    The message that is displayed with the console menu
    private java.util.Scanner sc
    a scanner to record the user's input

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ConsoleMenu()
    Constructor, no arguments to construct the console menu

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int binaryValidator​(java.lang.String type)
    The purpose of this function is confirm if a user wishes to complete an action this function asks for a 1-0 input and will loop until this condition has been met
    void displayMenu()
    The purpose of this function is to set and display the main menu's title, menu items and message and set the error message
    void displaySubMenu()
    The purpose of this function is to set and display the sub menu's title, menu items and message and set the error message
    int getAction()
    Gets the user's Action
    java.lang.String getErrorMessage()
    Gets the menu's Error Message
    java.lang.String[] getMenuItem()
    Gets the menu's Items
    java.lang.String getMenuTitle()
    Gets the menu's Title
    java.lang.String getMessage()
    Gets the menu's Message
    void loopMenu()
    The purpose of this function is to loop the menu It is the function required to get the console menu started in the controller
    int numberValidator​(java.lang.String catagory)
    The purpose of this function is to validate a users input as a number this function will loop until an acceptable input has been used
    void setAction​(int action)
    Sets the user's Action
    void setErrorMessage​(java.lang.String errorMessage)
    Sets the menu's Error Message
    void setMessage​(java.lang.String message)
    Sets the menu's Message
    void userAction()
    The purpose of this function is to read the users inputs and call the functions they select from the BookDao This function uses the scanner to read the user input and is the core function of the class

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      public void displayMenu()

    • displaySubMenu

      public void displaySubMenu()
      The purpose of this function is to set and display the sub menu's title, menu items and message and set the error message

    • userAction

      public void userAction() throws java.sql.SQLException
      The purpose of this function is to read the users inputs and call the functions they select from the BookDao This function uses the scanner to read the user input and is the core function of the class
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • loopMenu

      public void loopMenu() throws java.sql.SQLException
      The purpose of this function is to loop the menu It is the function required to get the console menu started in the controller
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • numberValidator

      public int numberValidator​(java.lang.String catagory)
      The purpose of this function is to validate a users input as a number this function will loop until an acceptable input has been used
      Parameters:
      catagory - the string designating which catagory the user is required to input
      Returns:
      an integer representing the users input

    • binaryValidator

      public int binaryValidator​(java.lang.String type)
      The purpose of this function is confirm if a user wishes to complete an action this function asks for a 1-0 input and will loop until this condition has been met
      Parameters:
      type - the string designating which catagory the user is required to input
      Returns:
      an integer representing the users input
